Guide.introduction: Did you know? 81% of data breaches occur due to weak or stolen passwords!
Guide.importance: In today's internet age, protecting your password is crucial. Just like you lock your house to protect your belongings, a strong password will help protect your personal information online.

point1.title: 1. One password per account
point1.description: Imagine: If you use the same key for both your house and your safe, when a thief gets the key, they can access everything. Passwords are the same - each account should have a unique password!

point2.title: 2. Passwords must be truly random
point2.description: Don't use easily guessable information like birthdays, pet names, or phone numbers. Create truly random passwords to make them hard to guess!

passwordStrength.title: How strong or weak is a password?
passwordStrength.description: When creating a password, the length and complexity determine how long it takes for a hacker to crack your password. Here are some examples:

passwordTips.title: Tips for creating a secure password

do.title: Things YOU SHOULD do:
list: Combine uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and special characters

don't.title: Things YOU SHOULD NOT do:
list: Use personal information (birthdays, names, phone numbers)
Use the same password for multiple accounts

extraAdvice.title: Tips to protect your account
list: Do not share your password with others
Do not enter your password on public computers
Use a password manager to store securely
